title: Learning and Motivation Strategies to Improve Productivity of Order Picking Workers

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of logistics systems and the ability to analyze work processes
context.additional_context: Education focusing on work efficiency analysis and incentive system design using mathematical modeling

learning_goals: Learners can propose improvement plans to reduce the time required for each step of the standard order-picking process by 20% within four weeks.
Learners can design a simulation model to establish motivation strategies for different worker types by applying Regulatory Focus (RF) theory.
Learners can verify the impact of monetary incentives on workers' initial productivity and learning curves through regression analysis.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
